Author: irrelative
Content:
I certainly wouldn't blame this on anyone but twitter. Twitter has probably the highest popularity/uptime ratio in the web 2.0 industry.

The site is routinely down during regular hours -- it was just a matter of time until they went down during a high profile event.

Author: timr
Content:
If the article is correct, and Paulson was actually short on ABX and mortgage-backed securities, the downside of his strategy was unlimited. Taleb's strategy (option trading) had a bounded loss.

It's unclear how balanced Paulson's fund was/is, but the article makes it sounds like he was playing with fire.

Author: far33d
Content: Yes, but this still doesn't actually hurt the people that hold mortgages (the homeowners). Whether or not my bank can handle the fact that I'm about to foreclose has nothing to do with my ability to (not) pay.

Author: far33d
Content:
Warren Buffett would beg to differ with this strategy.

If you trade on value, you shouldn't really care what the market is doing. If risk is mispriced, buy more, even if the price is going down and you are losing money in the short term.

Author: barns
Content: Release as early as possible, but not too early to have something usable.It's okay to trim features, but it's not okay to release something buggy or unusable.
